channel.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
channel.description:
I've been making some modifications to yakman's client473 pk client and now I'm running into a problem. -- getLocationX() added to class bb gets FIELD int[] bb.V -- I'm trying to output the value of "bb.V" with a simple System.out.println(); but i get the following error:
Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context --
I essentially know what it's trying to say but I don't know how to get around it? Is this going to require some bcel work and if so is their anybody who could point me in the right direction.
Speedster239...

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

speedster239:

if anyone could help me with their previous experience in the subject for the best way to circumvent it.[/quote][quote=“frank_, post:3, topic:153501”]again, learn java (or any programming language) before runescape cheating

Read full topic

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

Yakman made the client and specifically said that he wanted people to learn from it and that he wouldn’t be updating it for that reason. I’m obviously not at the level to write it myself but I am furthering my education by looking at his work and trying to prepare myself to properly update it. I don’t see why this is such a problem, really.

I fully understood that error (saying this for the 3rd time now) and I was just wondering if anyone could help me with their previous experience in the subject for the best way to circumvent it.

Speedster239…

Read full topic

@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“speedster239, post:8, topic:153501”]I didn’t know it was a nonstatic field until I got the error message at which point I came here to reference the best option in getting around this is this case.[/quote]So basically you just made your own hack-up of someone else’s work, which you didn’t even partially understand?

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

speedster239:

I didn’t know it was a nonstatic field until I got the error message at which point I came here to reference the best option in getting around this is this case.

If you knew any Java at all, you wouldn’t have tried accessing a nonstatic field in a static fashion, which would’ve resulted in this topic never existing.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

Or read this: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/index.html

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

If you knew any Java at all, you wouldn’t have tried accessing a nonstatic field in a static fashion, which would’ve resulted in this topic never existing. Breaking away from that, good job making whatever you were doing work.

Read full topic
item.source: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

frank_:

again, learn java (or any programming language) before runescape cheating

I know java, fairly well actually, and I know what this means (if you had read my post which you obviously didn’t). I’m asking how I would get around errors such as these.

[quote=“Polyfinite, post:4, topic:153501”]Class bb is Entity.
The problem is the fact that the field you hooked is not a class variable, yet an instance variable, meaning it must be called through an instance of a class, so you can’t call it strait from class bb, you need to call it from an instance of bb, like myEntityInstance.getLocationX().[/quote]

Thank you very much for this response…which actually helped.
EDIT: Thank you so much, i figured out that i needed to call it under bb.a.V
…and it worked <3

Read full topic
item.source: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @Polyfinite Polyfinite
item.description:
@Polyfinite wrote:

Class bb is Entity.
The problem is the fact that the field you hooked is not a class variable, yet an instance variable, meaning it must be called through an instance of a class, so you can’t call it strait from class bb, you need to call it from an instance of bb, like myEntityInstance.getLocationX().

Read full topic

item.title: Help: Non-static Variable Can Not Be Referenced From A Static Context
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Well the class “bb” (whatever it is) is dynamic, so you need to acquire an instance of the class. That means you need to use another hook to get the class and then this one to get the XLocation. Assuming that this class represents a NPC, you need to look in the array or whatever storage method they use to store the NPCs. Then you can use your hook.

Read full topic
